ammu.h File Reference

This file contains the interfaces present in the AMMU HAL. This also contains some related macros, structures and enums. More...

#include <ti/csl/cslr_mmu.h>

Detailed Description

This file contains the interfaces present in the AMMU HAL. This also contains some related macros, structures and enums.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ammuCacheExclusionEnable

Enum to set Cache Exclusion property of AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_CACHE_EXCLUSION_DISABLED 

Do not send exclusion side-band

AMMU_CACHE_EXCLUSION_ENABLED 

Send exclusion side-band

enum ammuL1AllocateWrite

Enum to set L1 Write allocate policy of AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L1_ALLOCATE_WRITE_DISABLED 

Writes are Not Allocated

AMMU_L1_ALLOCATE_WRITE_ENABLED 

Writes are Allocated

enum ammuL1CacheEnable

Enum to enable/disable L1 cache for AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L1_CACHE_DISABLED 

Disable the L1 Cache

AMMU_L1_CACHE_ENABLED 

Enable the L1 Cache

enum ammuL1PostedWrite

Enum to set L1 posted write policy of AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L1_POSTED_WRITE_DISABLED 

Set L1 Posted Write Policy as Not Posted

AMMU_L1_POSTED_WRITE_ENABLED 

Set L1 Posted Write Policy as Posted

enum ammuL1WritePolicy

Enum to set L1 write policy for AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L1_WRITE_POLICY_WRITETHROUGH 

Set write policy as Write Through

AMMU_L1_WRITE_POLICY_WRITEBACK 

Set write policy as Write Back

enum ammuL2AllocateWrite

Enum to set L2 Write allocate policy of AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L2_ALLOCATE_WRITE_DISABLED 

Writes are Not Allocated

AMMU_L2_ALLOCATE_WRITE_ENABLED 

Writes are Allocated

enum ammuL2CacheEnable

Enum to enable/disable L2 cache for AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L2_CACHE_DISABLED 

Disable the L2 Cache

AMMU_L2_CACHE_ENABLED 

Enable the L2 Cache

enum ammuL2PostedWrite

Enum to set L2 posted write policy of AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L2_POSTED_WRITE_DISABLED 

Set L2 Posted Write Policy as Not Posted

AMMU_L2_POSTED_WRITE_ENABLED 

Set L2 Posted Write Policy as Posted

enum ammuL2WritePolicy

Enum to set L2 write policy for AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_L2_WRITE_POLICY_WRITETHROUGH 

Set write policy as Write Through

AMMU_L2_WRITE_POLICY_WRITEBACK 

Set write policy as Write Back

enum ammuPageEnable

Enum to enable/disable the AMMU Page.

Enumerator
AMMU_PAGE_DISABLED 

Disable AMMU Page

AMMU_PAGE_ENABLED 

Enable AMMU Page

enum ammuPageSize

Enum to select the AMMU Page Size.

Enumerator
AMMU_PAGE_SIZE_4KB 

AMMU page size: 4 KB

AMMU_PAGE_SIZE_16KB 

AMMU page size: 16 KB

AMMU_PAGE_SIZE_128KB 

AMMU page size: 128 KB

AMMU_PAGE_SIZE_256KB 

AMMU page size: 256 KB

AMMU_PAGE_SIZE_32MB 

AMMU page size: 32 MB

AMMU_PAGE_SIZE_512MB 

AMMU page size: 512 MB

AMMU_PAGE_SIZE_INVALID 

AMMU page size: Invalid

enum ammuPageType_t

Enum to select the AMMU Page Type.

Enumerator
AMMU_PAGE_TYPE_SMALL 

AMMU page type: Small. Valid size: 4 KB or 16 KB

AMMU_PAGE_TYPE_MEDIUM 

AMMU page type: Medium. Valid size: 128 KB or 256 KB

AMMU_PAGE_TYPE_LARGE 

AMMU page type: Large. Valid size: 32 MB or 512 MB

AMMU_PAGE_TYPE_INVALID 

AMMU page type: Invalid

enum ammuPreloadEnable

Enum to enable/disable Pre-load for AMMU Page.

Enumerator
AMMU_PRELOAD_DISABLED 

Disable AMMU Page Pre-load

AMMU_PRELOAD_ENABLED 

Enable AMMU Page Pre-load

enum ammuVolatileEnable

Enum to enable volatile qualifier for AMMU page.

Enumerator
AMMU_VOLATILE_DISABLED 

Disable volatile qualifier for AMMU Page

AMMU_VOLATILE_ENABLED 

Enable volatile qualifier for AMMU Page

Function Documentation

int32_t AMMUConfigPage ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const ammuPageConfig_t *  ammuPageCfg 
)

This function configures the particular AMMU page.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of AMMU registers.
ammuPageCfgAMMU page configuration.
Returns
status Whether AMMU page is configured correctly. STW_SOK : Success STW_EFAIL : Failure
void AMMUInitPolicyParams ( ammuPolicyRegParams_t *  policyParams)

This function initializes the policy parameters to a default value.

Parameters
policyParamsAMMU Page's policy parameters.
Returns
None.
uint32_t AMMUMakePolicyReg ( const ammuPolicyRegParams_t *  policyParams)

This utility function forms the policy register value depending on the passed values.

Parameters
policyParamsAMMU Page's policy parameters
Returns
poilcyRegVal Value of the policy register.
